author: dlr
msg: A follow-up to r26484, assuring that our flag for whether peg
revisions require that we contact the repository during wc->*
copy/move operations actually gets set, and that we use the right URL
and revision number for copied WC paths.
* subversion/libsvn_client/copy.c
(setup_copy): Don't break out of the loop in which we examine our
copy sources before checking the peg revision.  Use the correct URL
and revision number for copied WC paths.

author: xsteve
msg: Fixed some byte compiler warnings
* trunk/contrib/client-side/emacs/psvn.el:
(svn-status-default-blame-arguments): Add to the psvn customize
group
(svn-status-next-line): Use forward-line instead of next-line
(svn-status-previous-line): Use forward-line with a negative
argument instead of previous-line

author: dlr
msg: Handle copy/move operations which use non-numeric svn_opt_revision_t's
(other than working or unspecified) for peg revisions.  (Non-numeric
operative revisions were already handled.)
* subversion/libsvn_client/copy.c
(NEED_REPOS_REVNUM): New macro capturing a boolean expression.
(setup_copy): Examine both operative and peg revision to determine
whether we need to convert a wc -> * operation into a repos -> *
operation.  Only set a copy source's peg revision to its
corresponding entry's revnum if we don't also need to ask the
repository to resolve the peg revision.

author: dlr
msg: Formalize a flow control macro which we apparently use in several
places already.
* subversion/include/private/svn_flowcontrol.h
New header file, providing a MAYBE_GOTO() macro.
* subversion/libsvn_fs_util/mergeinfo-sqlite-index.c
(MAYBE_CLEANUP): Remove macro, replacing all usage with
MAYBE_GOTO(cleanup, err).
* subversion/libsvn_wc/entries.c
(MAYBE_DONE): Redefine as an instance of MAYBE_GOTO().
Suggested by: lgo

author: cmpilato
msg: For issue #2780:  Teach the entries-file reading code to check for
canonicalization of paths found in the entries files.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/entries.c
(read_path): New.
(read_entry): Use read_path() instead of read_str() for path fields
in the 'entries' file.
